Shares of TerraForm Global Inc. GLBL, +0.16% were indicated up over 16% in premarket trade Tuesday, after the renewable energy company agreed to be acquired by Brookfield Asset Management for $787 million in cash and the assumption of $455 million in debt.

TerraForm had announced on Sept. 16 that it was exploring strategic alternatives to maximize shareholder value, and said in January that it entered into an exclusive deal with Brookfield to negotiate a potential buyout.

The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2017, subject to the approval of shareholders and the court overseeing the bankruptcy of SunEdison Inc. suneq which TerraForm had been spun off from.
Under terms of the deal, Brookfield will buy all the TerraForm Class A shares for $5.10 each, which represents a 20% premium to Monday's closing price of $4.25.
TerraForm's stock had gained 7.6% over the past three months through Monday, while Brookfield's had advanced 7.6% and the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% had climbed 6%.
